title: Balenbouche Estate Guesthouse, St. Lucia
text:
Visit Their Website 
Balenbouche Estate is an eco-friendly and family run guesthouse and cultural heritage located between the town of Soufriere and the international airport on St. Lucia . The 180-year-old plantation house, sugar mill, and four guest cottages are surrounded by 75 acres of farms and woodland, ancient trees, flower gardens, fruit orchards, lily ponds, and nature trails. Balenbouche is a popular venue for weddings and retreats. Several secluded beaches are within walking distance. 
Balenbouche Estate Guesthouse Rooms 
Each of the four cottages has its own distinct character, was created from historic structures, and is furnished with antiques and local artwork. The larger Banyan and Almond cottages offer two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living room and a kitchen; the Frangipani and Calabash cottages have one bedroom and one bathroom, verandas, and in-room refrigerators. All but Calabash feature natural-stone outdoor showers with solar hot water systems. The property is ideal for families and groups as well as couples. 
Balenbouche Estate Guesthouse Dining 
All meals are freshly prepared using many local and organic ingredients, some of which are grown on the Balenbouche estate. Vegetarian, vegan and raw food dishes can be prepared upon request. As of 2011, breakfast cost US$10, brunch or light lunch was US$ 15-$20 and dinner, US$ 25-$30. Most meals are served family or buffet style on the veranda of the elegant plantation house. 
Balenbouche Estate Activities and Amenities 
On-site amenities include daily breakfast service, tour planning, self-catering facilities, maid and laundry service, wedding planning, and free wireless internet and computer access. 
Balenbouche is well-suited for weddings and holiday groups, including yoga and wellness, artist and family retreats. Personalized event planning is available. The plantation house can seat up to 30 guests, larger groups are seated outdoors under tents. Up to 11 guests can sleep in the four cottages; additional visitors can stay at a guesthouse within walking distance, and two guest rooms in the Plantation House are available for group facilitators. Classes can be held outdoors, in one of the larger cottages, or in the historic cotton barn. Massages and other holistic therapies are offered on site.
